definition: spirit of a martyr/spirit of the brave departed/person of remarkable talent
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]
hero/outstanding/excellent/(literary) flower/blossom
quick/alert/efficacious/effective/to come true/spirit/departed soul/coffin

sentences.english: The Yngling will make its Olympic debut in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 英靈級作爲奧運會項目將在2004年首次登場。

sentences.english: His spirit would no longer remain with him.
sentences.chinese: 他的英靈將不在與盧克同在。

sentences.english: On the Pure Brightness, we held a memorial service for martyrs in the funerary park.
sentences.chinese: 清明節那天我們在墓園裏墓祭了烈士們的英靈。

sentences.english: Collection of HeYue Yingling was a set of characteristic selected poems in the properous Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《河嶽英靈集》爲盛唐頗具特色的詩選集。

sentences.english: But life has taught me that the hero is already in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 但是生活告訴我，我們的英靈早已經在天堂。

sentences.english: These shores will still swarm with the dead of my people.
sentences.chinese: 這一帶海岸仍將到處有我們祖先的英靈出沒。

sentences.english: His Malazan Book of the Fallen series is one the best works of writing I’ve ever come across.
sentences.chinese: 他的《瑪拉茲英靈錄》系列是我讀過的最好的書作。

definition: to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
homesick
to pass on the light of Buddha
singing
"sage of poetry", epithet of Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]
Jianzhen or Ganjin (688-763), Tang dynastic Buddhist monk, who crossed to Japan after several unsuccessful attempts, influential in Japanese Buddhism
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
Feast of All Souls (fifteenth day of seventh lunar month) (Buddhism)
to bless/to praise
swordsmanship
Su Wu (140-60 BC), Han Dynasty diplomat and statesman, regarded as a model of courage and faithful service
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
hero/towering figure
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
arsenal/store of arms
